intro: Dorstenia oligogyna, commonly known as the "gymnophyllum," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its unique, spiral-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically greenish-white in color, and it produces distinctive, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Dorstenia oligogyna is also noted for its ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments.
